etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, 'hand') stylized as 又(又) (yòu, 'hand') + 𰀁(𰀁) (yù, 'brush') = hand holding a brush
etymology.interpretation: The character 聿(yù) originally depicted a hand holding a brush, symbolizing the act of writing or drawing. It was initially used for the writing brush itself and later borrowed for other meanings.

examples.chinese: 古代文人以聿书写心志(古代文人以聿書寫心志)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài wénrén yǐ yù shūxiě xīnzhì.
examples.english: Ancient literati used the brush to write their aspirations.

examples.chinese: 书法之美在于用聿(書法之美在於用聿)，笔随心动(筆隨心動)。
examples.pinyin: Shūfǎ zhī měi zàiyú yòng yù, bǐ suí xīndòng.
examples.english: The beauty of calligraphy lies in using a brush, as the brush follows the movements of the heart.

examples.chinese: 他用聿写出了一篇优美的诗(他用聿寫出了一篇優美的詩)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng yù xiě chūle yī piān yōuměi de shī.
examples.english: He used the brush to compose a beautiful poem.
